dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 24.8 × 12.3 cm (9 3/4 × 4 13/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Collector's stamp in purple ink, verso lower center: R. Peltzer (Lugt 2231)
inscribed:
Signed in plate, lower right corner: HG. F.

Four lines in French and signature in margin below plate, lower center: Voyant Vostre angelycque... AULTRE NE VEULX... / CDE WETTHEM

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Rudolf Peltzer [1825-1910, Lugt 2231]; sale of the collections of Rudolf Peltzer, Grégoire Stroganoff, and Friedrich Schindler, Stuttgart, May 2, 1913, possibly lot 562; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
